feed.title: Nautical Backup Releases
feed.subtitle: Self-hosted software releases generated by selfh.st

entry.title: New release for Nautical Backup: v2.1.0
entry.content:
This update adds the following feature:

Group Priority (Order)

When using the Groups feature, the Priority will allow you to control the order in which containers are started/stopped.

Containers within a group are backed up with the highest priority first, in descending order.

Default If Missing: 100

Format: <integer>

properties nautical-backup.group.<group_name>.priority=<integer>

  • The backup order for the group paperless is: paperless-ngx (105) --> redis (90)
  • The backup order for the group authentic is: authentic-worker (100/default) --> redis (85)

yaml paperless-ngx: labels: - "nautical-backup.group=paperless" - "nautical-backup.group.paperless.priority=105" ```yaml redis: labels: - "nautical-backup.group=paperless,authentic" - "nautical-backup.group.paperless.priority=90" - "nautical-backup.group.authentic.priority=85"

yaml authentic-worker: labels: - "nautical-backup.group=authentic"

```

Thanks to @Riewest for requesting.

What's Changed

  • Update dependency mkdocs-material to v9.5.18 by @renovate in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/202
  • Fixed BACKUP_ON_START errors https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/issues/201
  • Add Group priority by @Minituff in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/205

Full Changelog: https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/compare/v2.0.0...v2.1.0

entry.title: New release for Nautical Backup: v2.1.1
entry.content:
What's Changed

  • Added a Homepage Dashboard example

    • Check out the docs to get this setup

  • Added 1 new return value to the API Dashboard endpoint: next_run

What Else Changed

  • Homepage example by @Minituff in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/207

Full Changelog: https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/compare/v2.1.0...v2.1.1

entry.title: New release for Nautical Backup: v2.2.0
entry.content:
What's Changed

  • Update minituff/nautical-backup Docker tag to v2.1.1 by @renovate in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/208
  • Update dependency fastapi to v0.110.2 by @renovate in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/211
  • Add Kickoff API endpoint by @Minituff in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/212

Closes https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/issues/209 by @Riewest

Kickoff Backup

POST /api/v1/nautical/kickoff_backup

Start a backup now in the background. The API will respond immediately.

All the Variables and Labels are respected.

Example response

json { "message": "Nautical Backup started successfully" }

Full Changelog: https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/compare/v2.1.1...v2.2.0

entry.title: New release for Nautical Backup: v2.3.0
entry.content:
Thank you to @valdearg for the PR https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/215 :+1: Thank you to @Riewest for the feature suggestion https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/issues/210

New Features

Enable/Disable CRON Schedule

Completely disable the recurring backup via a CRON scheudle.

This could be useful if you want to run Nautical manually via Backup On Start or the Rest API.

Default: true (CRON enabled)

properties CRON_SCHEDULE_ENABLED=false

Create a Dated Destination Folder

This option will tell Nautical to create a new destination folder on backup.

For example: /dest_folder/2024-04-05/contianer

Default: false

properties USE_DEST_DATE_FOLDER=true

Destination Folder Format

Use the Python time.strftime() module to format format the destination folder's name.

Default: %Y-%m-%d (2024-04-05 for example)

Format: Python time.strftime() format

properties DEST_DATE_FORMAT=Nautical Backup - %Y-%m-%d

[!TIP] You are allowed to use almost anything in this field

While it may be a intended to use the date format here, you don't have to. You could set this value to latest backup or insert addional text around the date format like this: Nautical Backup - %Y-%m-%d. Use this setting to add a prefix and/or suffix to the dated folder.

Destination Folder Path

Use this option to designate which path strategy is used when creating a dated destination directory.

  • date/container = /dest_folder/2024-04-05/container1
  • container/date = /dest_folder/container1/2024-04-05

Default: date/container

Options: container/date or date/container

properties DEST_DATE_PATH_FORMAT="date/container"

What's Changed

  • Update docs by @renovate in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/213
  • Create dated destination folder by @Minituff in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/217
  • Allow disable of CRON schedule by @Minituff in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/219

Full Changelog: https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/compare/v2.2.0...v2.3.0

entry.title: New release for Nautical Backup: v2.3.1
entry.content:
What's Changed

Added better logic for Nautical to skip itself. @wedge-kc identified an issue https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/issues/225 where Nautical was trying to back itself up and therefore would stop its own container. This issue should be fixed now.

  • Better logic to skip self by @Minituff in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/226
  • Update docs by @renovate in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/220
  • Update dependency black to v24.4.2 by @renovate in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/214
  • Update dependency pytest to v8.1.2 by @renovate in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/221
  • Update dependency pydantic to v2.7.1 by @renovate in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/223
  • Update dependency mkdocs-material to v9.5.20 - autoclosed by @renovate in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/218

Full Changelog: https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/compare/v2.3.0...v2.3.1
